description: Test your knowledge of computers, gadgets, and digital innovation

questions.question: Which robot farms vertically?
questions.story: FarmBot is an automated precision farming robot that can plant, water, and monitor crops in vertical gardens, revolutionizing urban agriculture.

questions.question: Which computer reads brain waves?
questions.story: Neuralink's brain-computer interface uses thousands of microscopic threads to read brain activity with unprecedented precision.

questions.question: Which drone plants trees?
questions.story: DroneSeed uses swarms of heavy-lift drones to rapidly reforest areas after wildfires, planting specially designed seed vessels.

questions.question: Which phone bends fully?
questions.story: The Samsung Galaxy Fold pioneered the foldable phone category with a screen that can fold completely in half without damage.

questions.question: Which watch measures blood oxygen?
questions.story: The Apple Watch Series 6 introduced blood oxygen monitoring using LED lights to measure light reflected back from blood vessels.

questions.question: Which printer creates organs?
questions.story: CELLINK's bioprinters can create living tissue structures using bioink containing human cells, advancing organ transplant research.

questions.question: Which car drives underwater?
questions.story: The Rinspeed sQuba is the world's first diving car, capable of submerging and driving underwater while keeping passengers safe.

questions.question: Which glasses help blind see?
questions.story: OrCam MyEye attaches to glasses and uses AI to read text, recognize faces, and describe surroundings to visually impaired users.

questions.question: Which keyboard projects light?
questions.story: Celluon's laser keyboard projects a full-size QWERTY keyboard onto any flat surface, detecting finger movements for typing.

questions.question: Which screen bends most?
questions.story: The LG Flex display can bend to different curvatures, allowing users to customize their viewing experience for optimal comfort.

questions.question: Which robot performs surgery?
questions.story: The Da Vinci Surgical System allows surgeons to perform minimally invasive procedures with unprecedented precision using robotic arms controlled from a console.

questions.question: Which satellite cleans space?
questions.story: ClearSpace-1 is the first satellite specifically designed to capture and remove space debris, using a unique four-armed capture mechanism.

questions.question: Which headset reads lips?
questions.story: TranscribeGlass uses AI to read lips and convert speech to text in real-time, helping deaf and hard-of-hearing individuals communicate more effectively.

questions.question: Which fabric generates power?
questions.story: PowerFelt, developed by Wake Forest University, converts body heat and movement into electrical energy, potentially powering small electronic devices.

questions.question: Which robot explores volcanoes?
questions.story: NASA's VolcanoBot is designed to explore volcanic fissures too dangerous for humans, providing crucial data about volcanic systems and potential eruptions.

questions.question: Which chip is smallest?
questions.story: IBM's 2-nanometer chip technology, announced in 2021, can fit 50 billion transistors in a fingernail-sized space, promising unprecedented computing power and energy efficiency.

questions.question: Which AI writes music?
questions.story: OpenAI's MuseNet can generate 4-minute musical compositions in 15 different styles, from classical to jazz, using deep neural networks trained on hundreds of thousands of MIDI compositions.

questions.question: Which robot climbs walls?
questions.story: Disney Research's VertiGo robot uses propellers to create downforce, allowing it to drive smoothly up walls and across ceilings while maintaining control and stability.

questions.question: Which battery charges fastest?
questions.story: Xiaomi's HyperCharge technology can fully charge a 4,000mAh phone battery in just 8 minutes at 200W, setting a world record for fastest mobile charging.

questions.question: Which computer is coldest?
questions.story: IBM's Q System One quantum computer operates at 0.015 Kelvin (-273.135°C), making it one of the coldest places in the universe, necessary for maintaining quantum states.

questions.question: Which robot swims deepest?
questions.story: The Hadal Explorer robot, developed by Woods Hole Oceanographic Institution, can dive to 11,000 meters, exploring the ocean's deepest trenches with advanced sensors and cameras.

questions.question: Which lens changes color?
questions.story: Acuvue Oasys with Transitions is the first contact lens that automatically darkens when exposed to bright light, using photochromic technology to enhance visual comfort.

questions.question: Which camera sees through walls?
questions.story: Vayyar's 4D imaging technology uses radio frequency waves to create 3D images of objects behind walls, helping in search and rescue, medical monitoring, and security applications.

questions.question: Which paint generates power?
questions.story: Solar paint, developed by RMIT University, contains synthetic molybdenum-sulphide that splits water vapor into hydrogen and oxygen, generating clean energy even from humid air.

questions.question: Which shoes lace themselves?
questions.story: Nike's HyperAdapt shoes use an 'adaptive lacing' system that automatically tightens when you step in, using sensors to detect foot position and adjust fit accordingly.

questions.question: Which microscope sees atoms?
questions.story: The Quantum Electron Microscope, developed at MIT, can image individual atoms without damaging delicate samples by using quantum interactions, achieving resolution below 1 angstrom.

questions.question: Which elevator goes farthest?
questions.story: KONE's UltraRope technology enables elevators to travel up to 1,000 meters in a single run, using carbon fiber cables that are lighter and more durable than traditional steel ropes.

questions.question: Which robot reads emotions?
questions.story: SoftBank's Pepper robot uses facial recognition and voice analysis to detect human emotions, adjusting its behavior and responses based on the emotional state of the person it's interacting with.

questions.question: Which printer is fastest?
questions.story: The Landa S10 Nanographic Printing Press can print 6,500 sheets per hour in eight colors, using water-based nano-pigments that form an ultra-thin layer on any substrate.

questions.question: Which scanner reads thoughts?
questions.story: NextMind's device uses non-invasive EEG technology to decode visual neural activity in real-time, allowing users to control digital interfaces directly with their thoughts.
